meanings.definition: To harm or damage someone or something
meanings.sent1: The storm damnified the roof of the house, causing leaks.
meanings.sent2: The careless driver damnified the parked car by crashing into it.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel damnified the garden by digging up all the flower bulbs.
meanings.sent4: The virus damnified the computer system, corrupting important files.
meanings.sent5: The bully's words damnified the self-esteem of the shy student.

meanings.definition: To cause someone to suffer a loss or injury
meanings.sent1: The scam damnified many unsuspecting victims, causing them financial loss.
meanings.sent2: The unfair ruling damnified the innocent party, leading to an unjust outcome.
meanings.sent3: The broken elevator damnified the office workers, making them climb many flights of stairs.
meanings.sent4: The false accusation damnified the reputation of the respected professor.
meanings.sent5: The harsh criticism damnified the motivation of the aspiring artist.
